details:
Some minor security issues have been identified and fixed in binutils in
Debian LTS. These are:


* [CVE-2016-2226](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2226)
Exploitable buffer overflow.
* [CVE-2016-4487](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-4487)
Invalid write due to a use-after-free to array btypevec.
* [CVE-2016-4488](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-4488)
Invalid write due to a use-after-free to array ktypevec.
* [CVE-2016-4489](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-4489)
Invalid write due to integer overflow.
* [CVE-2016-4490](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-4490)
Write access violation.
* [CVE-2016-4492](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-4492)
Write access violations.
* [CVE-2016-4493](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-4493)
Read access violations.
* [CVE-2016-6131](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-6131)
Stack buffer overflow when printing bad bytes in Intel Hex objects


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these problems have been fixed in version
2.22-8+deb7u3.


We recommend that you upgrade your binutils packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
